message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a novel local feature for texture and material classification, which is a common task in computer vision and image processing. The proposed method involves defining a point description on an adaptive coordinate system, using a binary sequence descriptor, and employing a multi-scale strategy. These techniques are commonly used in computer vision and image processing, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves machine learning techniques, such as feature extraction and classification, which are relevant to the cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the robustness of the proposed method to illumination variation and image rotation, which suggests that it may be relevant to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. Finally, the paper compares the proposed method to a feature extracted by Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), which suggests that it may be relevant to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category.
